sentence.idiomatic: In the process of demolition and relocation, the concerns of the common person are nothing more than such issues as standards for relocation compensation being too low, and the inappropriate use of coercion.

word.literal: to tear down a building and relocating the resident
party (who tears down a building and relocates the residents)

sentence.idiomatic: According to the 'Urban Housing Relocation Management Ordinance,' those tearing down housing requiring relocation of residents are obliged to provide compensation to those who must be relocated.

word.literal: to be in the course of
to tear down a building and relocate resident

sentence.idiomatic: The issue of demolition and relocation has been one of the most closely-watched focal points over the entire process of urban construction development.

word.literal: the party who breaks a contract

sentence.idiomatic: According to the contract, the party that breaches it is obliged make compensation for the losses incurred.

word.literal: party wishing to tear down building

sentence.idiomatic: He's the one resisting relocation around here. He's already held up against the officials for two years, dead-set against moving.
